answer: Authors should list names surname first, followed by a comma and initials, use Roman text for article/dataset titles, include a data availability statement, no more than 60 references (not strictly enforced), acknowledgements optional, author contributions, titles within two lines (75 characters, avoid technical terms, abbreviations, active verbs), a fully referenced ~200 word summary paragraph, main text of 2,500 words, and for typical 6 page articles, 4 figures/tables. Research articles at most 7,000 words excluding reference list.
